page.title: 04HOUSING IN KEMBERTON
page.content: A number of houses are conversions of other buildings. Two barns, a mill, a blacksmith's shop, a wheelwright's shop and an old post office are now private residences. The canteen and gatehouse of Kemberton's Second World War airfield are now bungalows. There are two groups of semi-detached council houses, one group of six built in 1933 and another of 4 built in 1943 Most of these are now owner-occcupied. There are also a number of houses built in the 1960s and 1970s. They include some farm cottages but most are substantial detached houses. Some have been erected where other buildings have been demolished. One house stands on the site of the old wooden village hall, and there is a bungalow on the site of the 'Fighting Cock' inn.
